description: The fortified island headquarters of the Marines, serving as the center of military power for the World Government. In this episode, it has been evacuated of all civilians and transformed into a massive battlefield with 100,000 elite troops, 50 warships, the Seven Warlords, and the Three Admirals assembled.

keyEvents.title: Marineford Evacuated and Fortified
keyEvents.description: All civilians have been evacuated from Marineford to the Sabaody Archipelago as the island is transformed into the greatest military stronghold ever assembled in preparation for Whitebeard's attack.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the unprecedented scale of the coming battle and the World Government's determination to eliminate Ace and defeat Whitebeard.

keyEvents.title: Marine Battle Formation Revealed
keyEvents.description: The full military might assembled at Marineford is shown: 100,000 elite Marine soldiers, 50 warships, the Seven Warlords of the Sea, and the Three Admirals positioned at the execution platform.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Marineford as the site of the greatest concentration of military power in the series to date.

keyEvents.title: Sengoku's World-Changing Announcement
keyEvents.description: From Marineford, Fleet Admiral Sengoku broadcasts to the entire world that Ace is the son of Gol D. Roger, fundamentally changing the stakes of the execution.
keyEvents.significance: Marineford becomes the stage for one of the most significant announcements in One Piece history.

statusHistory.reason: Serving as the battlefield for the war with Whitebeard

description: An archipelago of massive mangrove trees where evacuated Marineford civilians, journalists, and reporters have gathered to watch the broadcast of Ace's execution and the war with Whitebeard.

keyEvents.title: Marineford Civilians Evacuated to Sabaody
keyEvents.description: All civilians from Marineford have been relocated to the Sabaody Archipelago, where they gather with journalists to watch the execution broadcast.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Sabaody as the location where the world watches the historic events at Marineford unfold.

keyEvents.title: Worldwide Shock at Ace's Heritage
keyEvents.description: People gathered at Sabaody react with shock and horror to Sengoku's revelation that Ace is Roger's son, with reporters frantically working to spread this earth-shattering news.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the global impact of the revelation through the reactions of ordinary people and the media.

statusHistory.reason: Serving as sanctuary for evacuated civilians and broadcast viewing location

description: Massive gates that control access to Marineford. These enormous structures serve as the final barrier protecting Marine Headquarters from invasion. In this episode, they are firmly closed, blocking Luffy's path.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Arrives at Closed Gates
keyEvents.description: Luffy and his allies reach the Gates of Justice only to find them firmly sealed, creating a major obstacle to reaching Ace in time.
keyEvents.significance: The closed gates represent the final barrier between Luffy and his mission to save Ace, raising the stakes as time runs out.

statusHistory.reason: Gates are closed and secured against intrusion

description: An island in the South Blue where Portgas D. Rouge gave birth to Ace after carrying him for 20 months. This is Ace's birthplace and the location of his mother's sacrifice.

keyEvents.title: Ace's Birthplace Revealed
keyEvents.description: Sengoku reveals that Ace was born on Batelilla Island in the South Blue, where Rouge died after giving birth following her 20-month pregnancy.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the location of one of the most significant births in One Piece history and the site of Rouge's ultimate sacrifice.
